title: Math Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey City University
Interview Descriptions: the interview was smooth. management seems nice and knowledgeable. ask basic questions and my record for math skills. casuals dress, friendly environment. gather info and gave tour of the place where tutoring takes place. explain step by step procedure with student
Interview Questions: what skill sets you acquire for this role?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey City University (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: I got the based on a relationship I had. I am not particularly experienced but I have a lot of know how. The managers interviewing provided very basic questions to just check for competency.
Interview Questions: How can you improve this position?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Jersey City University in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: We had 2 zoom interviews because it was in the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic. The first zoom interview was with 1 woman and the second zoom interview was with 2 men.
Interview Questions: What's an example of a time you had to admit you were wrong?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at New Jersey City University (Jersey City, NJ) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Long but cut in dry.. Like any other job they want to how you would  you be a great fit for the company.. As well what will skills do you have for the company to grow..
Interview Questions: How would I benefit in helping the company grow?

title: Computer Science Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at New Jersey City University
Interview Descriptions: Interview went really well. Very easy going supervisors. They are super friendly and I didn't feel any pressure when I got to the interview. Just brought my resume and transcripts
Interview Questions: How many coding languages do you know?

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at New Jersey City University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Short interview process. Flexible job hours with professional development. Great team and work environment. Definitely recommend this job to any full-time college students or even those pursuing a masters that just need some extra income.
Interview Questions: How can you meet the demands of this role?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at New Jersey City University (Newark, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was in two parts, first with a search committee, and then with the direct supervisor.  Both sessions were held on the same day after an initial phone screening.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Student Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at New Jersey City University (Jersey City, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I was there under a student assistant program and i was just assigned to a department. I didn't know what department I was going to at all, and I was given the start date two days prior to. When you meet the staff, they were all very friendly and helpful and stayed in touch constantly.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at New Jersey City University
Interview Descriptions: Short, entire process took about 2 weeks. The interview was very informal and easy going. Dependent on the position, you may be asked for a writing sample or to take an exam. Usually about 2-4 interviewers in a room.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Science Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at New Jersey City University (Jersey City, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: You are asked the basics like what subject you like to help students with, your availability, what you think this position entails. Once you complete these you will participate in various training sessions such as legal matters  (plagiarism, behavior, students whom may have additional needs)
Interview Questions: When is your availability? What subjects can you help in?
